summary: The Great Lakes Icebreaker Act of 2025 directs the Coast Guard to develop a strategy for the design and construction of a new icebreaker for the Great Lakes.  It mandates a pilot program to assess the current icebreaking fleet's effectiveness and requires reports on icebreaking operations. The bill also modifies and expands reporting requirements regarding the costs associated with meeting icebreaking standards and the requirements of section 564 of title 14, United States Code.
